net.sf.mmm.service.base.client

Class AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller.AbstractRemoteInvocationQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.service.base.client.AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller.AbstractRemoteInvocationQueue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadDefaultFailureCallback, AttributeWriteDefaultFailureCallback, RemoteInvocationQueue, AttributeReadId<String>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractRemoteInvocationCommandCaller.RemoteInvocationCommandQueueImpl, AbstractRemoteInvocationServiceCaller.RemoteInvocationServiceQueueImpl
    Enclosing class:
    AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller<QUEUE extends RemoteInvocationQueue,CALL extends RemoteInvocationCall,TX_CALLS extends GenericRemoteInvocationTransactionalCalls<CALL>,REQUEST extends GenericRemoteInvocationRequest<CALL,TX_CALLS>>

    protected abstract class AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller.AbstractRemoteInvocationQueue
extends Object
implements RemoteInvocationQueue
    This is the abstract base implementation of RemoteInvocationQueue.

                     boolean hasOpenTransaction)
        This method collects the GenericRemoteInvocationTransactionalCalls for this queue recursively.
        Parameters:
        requestBuilder - is the AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller.RequestBuilder.
        hasOpenTransaction - - true if a transaction has already been opened, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if a transaction is currently open, false otherwise.

      • getDefaultFailureCallback

        public Consumer<Throwable> getDefaultFailureCallback()
        Description copied from interface: RemoteInvocationQueue
        This method gets the default callback to handle failures that occurred on service invocations. It will be used as fallback if no failure callback is specified explicitly. Queues will inherit the default failure callback from their parent. A toplevel queue inherits from the invocation caller.
        Specified by:
        getDefaultFailureCallback in interface AttributeReadDefaultFailureCallback
        Specified by:
        getDefaultFailureCallback in interface RemoteInvocationQueue
        Returns:
        the default failure-callback.

      • getParentQueue

      • getState

        public RemoteInvocationQueueState getState()
        This method gets the RemoteInvocationQueueState of this queue. The RemoteInvocationQueueState of a new queue is initially RemoteInvocationQueueState.OPEN. After RemoteInvocationQueue.commit() is called the status turns to RemoteInvocationQueueState.COMITTED. After RemoteInvocationQueue.cancel() is called it turns to RemoteInvocationQueueState.CANCELLED. As soon as the status is closed (NOT RemoteInvocationQueueState.OPEN), it can NOT be opened anymore and further adding of service invocations to the queue will fail.
        Specified by:
        getState in interface RemoteInvocationQueue
        Returns:
        the RemoteInvocationQueueState of this queue.

      • requireOpen

        protected void requireOpen()
        Internal method to ensure this queue is still open.

      • requireNoCurrentCall

        protected void requireNoCurrentCall()
        Internal method to ensure that no current call is pending.

      • requireNoChildQueue

        protected void requireNoChildQueue()
        Internal method to ensure that this queue is the current active queue and no child-queue has been opened and not completed.

      • commit

        public void commit()
        This method completes this queue. After the call of this method the queue can NOT be used anymore.
        If this is the root-queue all collected invocations will be send to the server immediately on RemoteInvocationQueue.commit(). Otherwise, if this is a sub-queue (a queue created while another queue was already open), the collected invocations will be appended to the parent queue.
        NOTE:
        Committing an empty queue is cheap and will have no effect but closing the queue. Therefore it is totally legal to open a queue in your generic infrastructure by default then perform some sort of initialization that may or may not cause service invocations on that queue and finally commit the queue.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface RemoteInvocationQueue

      • close

        private void close()
        This method closes this queue. It is called from commit() and cancel().

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        This method cancels this queue. All collected invocations will be discarded including those from sub-queues. If this queue has a parent queue, the parent queue is NOT affected by this operation.
        NOTE:
        This operation should only be used in very specific situations.
        Specified by:
        cancel in interface RemoteInvocationQueue
